The Problem

AI agents need to spend money.
You need control over how they do it.

01

Agents are transacting

AI agents are booking flights, ordering groceries, managing subscriptions. They need to spend money to complete tasks.

02

Humans lose visibility

When an agent makes a purchase, you often don't know until it's done. No approval flow. No spending limits. No audit trail.

03

Existing tools don't fit

Payment systems were designed for humans clicking buttons. They can't handle autonomous, high-frequency agent transactions.

How It Works

Three steps to authorized agent payments.

1

Define policies

Set spending limits, allowed merchants, approval thresholds, and custom rules for each agent.

2

Agent requests action

Before executing a payment, your agent calls AgentAuth with transaction details.

3

Real-time decision

We evaluate policies and return approve/deny in under 100ms. You execute or block.

<100ms

Authorization time

99.99%

0

Fund custody

Real-time authorization simulation

Under the hood - every transaction calls our API:

POST /v1/authorize
{
  "agent_id": "agent_demo_h1829s",
  "action": "payment",
  "transaction": {
    "amount": 49.99,
    "currency": "USD",
    "merchant": "Amazon",
    "category": "E-Commerce"
  }
}

// Response in <100ms
{ "decision": "ALLOW", "authorization_code": "auth_xyz123", "latency_ms": 34 }

Why AgentAuth

Authorization designed for autonomous agents.

Real-time authorization

Every agent action is evaluated against your policies before execution. Sub-100ms decisions.

<100ms

Granular policies

Set limits by agent, merchant, time, amount, or custom rules. Full programmatic control.

Custom rules

Complete audit trail

Every decision logged with full context. Exportable for compliance and debugging.

Full logs

No fund custody

We authorize, you execute. Your money stays with your payment processor.

Zero custody

For Developers

Integrate in minutes.

Three lines to authorize. Full SDKs for Python, TypeScript, and Go. Comprehensive documentation and examples to get you started fast.

Read the DocsView on GitHub
agent.ts
import { AgentAuth } from "@agentauth/sdk";

const auth = new AgentAuth({ 
  apiKey: process.env.AGENTAUTH_API_KEY 
});

// Before making a purchase
const decision = await auth.authorize({
  agentId: "agent_shopping_7x8k2m",
  action: "payment",
  merchant: "amazon.com",
  amount: 149.99,
  currency: "USD",
});

if (decision.approved) {
  await processPayment();
  await auth.confirm(decision.id);
} else {
  console.log("Blocked:", decision.reason);
}
